meanings.definition: The act of removing sacred or religious qualities from something.
meanings.sent1: The desacralization of the ancient temple left it feeling empty and devoid of spiritual significance.
meanings.sent2: The desacralization of the ceremony made it more accessible to people of different beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The desacralization of the old tree involved replacing its sacred offerings with colorful ribbons.
meanings.sent4: The desacralization of the traditional ritual was like stripping away layers of history and tradition.
meanings.sent5: The desacralization of the sacred text turned it into a mere historical document.

meanings.definition: The process of secularizing or making something non-religious.
meanings.sent1: The desacralization of the holiday celebration removed all religious symbols and references.
meanings.sent2: The desacralization of the school curriculum aimed to make it more inclusive of diverse beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The desacralization of the ancient relic involved turning it into a tourist attraction.
meanings.sent4: The desacralization of the sacred site felt like erasing centuries of spiritual significance.
meanings.sent5: The desacralization of the traditional ceremony marked a shift towards a more secular society.
